description: Construction of 3 x three storey dwelling houses, including excavation to provide a lower ground floor level, on-site amenity and refuse storage ( following demolition of existing garages) (Alternative scheme to planning permission ref: PP/2015/0662)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 597 - 01AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 02AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 03AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 04AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 05AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 06AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 07AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 08AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 09AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 10AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 11AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 12AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 13AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 14AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 15AMEND dated June 2016, 597 - 16AMEND dated June 2016, 597/300 Rev C dated May 2017, 597/301 Rev C dated May 2017, 597/302 Rev C dated May 2017,  597/305 Rev A dated May 2017, 597/13 dated April 2016, Traffic Management Proposals Rev B dated 21/06/2017 prepared by GP Basements & Refurbishment Ltd, Noise Mitigation Measures dated 01/03/2017 prepared by GP Basements & Refurbishment Ltd, Air Quality and Dust Management Plan dated 01/03/2017 prepared by GP Basements & Refurbishment Ltd, Environmental Noise Assessment Report dated 05/05/2017 prepared by Soundtesting Acoustic Consultancy & Air Leakage Specialists, Proposed materials summary prepared by Design 2 Architectural Services, Remediation Method Statement dated 02/12/2016 prepared by Land Science
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those as described on the proposed plans of development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD 2013 policies 7A, Local Variation 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1(g), 2.1 (a) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.

| Refuse and recycling storage areas and cycle parking spaces indicated on drawing reference 597/300 Rev C dated May 2017; shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan 2016 policy 5.16.

| Construction and remediation works are to be carried out in accordance with the construction and logistics plan dated Traffic Management Proposals Rev B dated 21/06/2017 prepared by GP Basements & Refurbishment Ltd hereby approved. A report demonstrating the effectiveness of the remediation works carried out will need to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the use.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 5.14 and 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications), no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| The applicant shall reinstate the redundant crossover to the site before any part of the development permitted is occupied or brought into use.

Reason: In the interests of highway safety, in accordance with the Councils Vehicle Crossover Guidance July 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.
| Noise mitigation measures should be carried out in accordance with the Noise Mitigation Measures Report dated 01/03/2017 prepared by GP Basements & Refurbishment Ltd hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and to safeguard the occupants from the effect of road noise, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy 2012, policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013, policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 and BS4142.
| Air quality management measures should be carried out in accordance with the Air Quality and Dust Management Plan dated 01/03/2017 prepared by GP Basements & Refurbishment Ltd hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy 2012, policy 7A of Ealing Council's Development Management Policies DPD adopted 2013, policy 7.14 of the London Plan 2016 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2012.

| Remediation measures should be carried out in accordance with the contamination land remediation scheme Remediation Method Statement dated 02/12/2016 prepared by Land Science hereby approved. Following completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be produced and submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy 2012 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.
